what: A photo claimed that military vehicles are combating COVID-19 in Palermo, Italy.
explanation: Sicilian media wrote that military indeed driving through Palermo, but vehicles were comng back from a military exercise and had nothing to do with the virus as at the time there were a handful of confirmed COVID-19 cases in Sicily.

what: A Saudi Arabian study for a MERS vaccine is linked to the outbreak of Coronavirus
explanation: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be false. The Saudi clinical trial is investigating a vaccine for the MERS Coronavirus strain, not the 2019 Novel Coronavirus.

what: Post claims food products such as rice, fortune cookies, mi goreng noodles, ice tea and "Chinese red bull" are contaminated with coronavirus. Also some areas of Sydney are supposedly identified as contaminated.
explanation: AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be false. A viral infectious diseases expert says there is no evidence of food being a source of any coronavirus transmission. The Facebook post also lists information from the “Department of Diseasology Parramatta” conducting tests showing “positive readings” for the virus at train stations in four Sydney suburbs. NSW Health confirmed to AAP FactCheck there is no such organisation as the “Department of Diseasology Parramatta” and there have been no “positive readings” at train stations.

what: Claim that a "Wuhan super virus" originated in a Chinese biosecurity lab and has infected more than 100,000 in Wuhan
explanation: There is no evidence that the 2019 Novel Coronavirus came from a Chinese laboratory. The WHO says the virus most likely originated in an animal. The number of cases of infection with the coronavirus in Wuhan has not reached 100,000 as claimed in the video.

what: Claim that photos show dogs being killed in China as part of efforts to combat COVID-19
explanation: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the post to be partly false. While there are media reports concerning pets being killed in China because of fears over the spread of Covid-19, they remain unverified and have been denied by authorities. The photos accompanying the Facebook post are unrelated to Covid-19. It is true that World Health Organization’s advice is there is no evidence that companion animals/pets can be infected with Covid-19 despite a single case in Hong Kong of a dog testing “weak positive”.

what: Claim that notes from an "uncle" who "graduated with a master's degree" and worked at Shenzhen Hospital is advice on COVID-19 symptoms and treatment
explanation: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the post to contain a mixture of true and false claims. A runny nose, sputum, dry cough and pneumonia can be symptoms of COVID-19 however not everyone infected with the disease will have them. Disease expert Prof Collingnon says temperatures around 26 to 27 degrees C won’t kill the virus however UV light from the sun can be effective in drying out the virus. Understanding of how long COVID-19 survives on surfaces is limited, with the WHO referring to previous studies of other viruses to estimate a range of a few hours to a few days. Drinking warm water, avoiding iced drinks and gargling warm salt water are not treatments or preventions, according to Prof Cunningham, however staying hydrated is important and gargling may relieve sore throats. The timeline for progression of COVID-19 symptoms is partly accurate but not everyone will experience all of these symptoms or in that order. Prof Cunningham also said it was not accurate to say infection will happen first in the throat, as the delicate tissues behind the nose are more likely starting points.

what: Claim that the 2019 novel coronavirus (COVID-19) is more deadly than Ebola or HIV
explanation: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be false. The post’s claim that coronavirus is the most deadly disease in history is not correct. Global fatalities for HIV and Ebola are far higher, figures from the World Health Organization and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention show.

what: Claim that pic of vegan food products left on otherwise bare supermarket shelf is related to COVID-19 outbreak and panic buying
explanation: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be incorrectly linking the supermarket shelf image to the 2019/20 COVID-19 coronavirus outbreak. The image of a supermarket shelf full of vegan foods while the shelves either side remain empty has nothing to do with the COVID-19 coronavirus outbreak. It was originally taken in 2017 in the United States when Hurricane Harvey hit the southern state of Texas.

what: Claim that disease outbreaks and pandemics correspond with election years.
explanation: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found no correlation between election years and virus outbreaks. The outbreaks of SARS, Bird Flu and COVID-19 do not line up with the dates claimed in the post. In the case of Zika virus, the disease has had multiple outbreaks since 2014 in parts of Oceania and in Brazil. Bird Flu, MERS and Ebola have not been reported in Australia and have not been a significant feature of local political discussion or debate. Considering overseas elections, such as US presidential elections, there is also no consistent pattern of outbreaks occurring in election years.

explanation: The video author refers to a patent filed in 2004 but this patent concerns another type of coronavirus. Moreover, filing a patent for a virus does not mean that it was created.

what: Facebook post claiming that SPA shelters "are overwhelmed by the abandonment of dogs and cats due to the coronavirus".
explanation: SPA president told AFP the claim was false. However, he fears a saturation of shelters, closed to the public because of containment measures.

what: phillippines
explanation: The claim is false; the Philippine Department of Health denied issuing the advisory.

what: video showing panic buying allegedly in us during virus outbreak
explanation: But the video has been shared in a misleading context; it has circulated online since November 2019, weeks before the novel coronavirus, COVID-19, was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

what: water used in an islamic ablution ritual can kill the novel coronavirus
explanation: health experts warn that water alone cannot kill the virus and recommend that people wash their hands with soap and water for effective protection.

what: photos purportedly showing indians bathing in cow dung to prevent infection
explanation: the photos show participants at an annual cow dung festival held in the southern region of India in October 2019, several weeks before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

what: ugandan pres announces postponement of elections
explanation: The claim is false; an electoral commission official issued a flat denial, labelling the claim “nonsensical”.

what: video of alleged panicked shoppers storming supermarket amid coronavirus pandemic
explanation: The claim is false; the video was in fact filmed in Germany in 2011, nearly a decade before the coronavirus pandemic broke out.

what: claim that us elections years coincide with major disease outbreaks
explanation: several years of discovery or the associated spread of a disease do not match election years, national and international health organizations said.

what: australia pm about to announce a national lockdown
explanation: The claim is misleading; the Australian Prime Minister’s Office refuted the details of the post; Australia's government told its citizens on March 18 not to travel abroad and warned those already overseas to come home but did not order a "lockdown"; AFP found the wording of the misleading posts was identical to Malaysia’s announcement of a nationwide lockdown.

what: A photo showing nurses holding a sign to denounce police violence
explanation: It's a photomontage.

what: A video showing a brawl this week took place in a supermarket in Aubervilliers (Seine-Saint-Denis) because of coronavirus.
explanation: This scene actually took place in May 2019, according to a police source

what: Social media posts suggesting that people who answered government with texts saying they won't respect confinement measures are now facing justice
explanation: The Nanterre Court denied having received any instruction to prosecute senders of these messages, and the messages present many inconsistencies.

what: claim that coronavirus is not new showing vials of coronavirus vaccines for animals as evidence
explanation: This is false; coronaviruses affecting cattle or canines differ from the new virus strain affecting humans, for which no vaccine exists.

what: breathing air from a hair dryer or a sauna can prevent or cure COVID 19
explanation: This is false; an expert in coronaviruses said these methods would not be effective, while a cell biologist said there is no evidence the virus can be treated via heat.

what: a video purporting to show how the coronavirus is transmitted betwen people
explanation: The claim is false; the video was produced by a regional hospital trust within the UK’s public healthcare system, the National Health Service (NHS), in May 2010 about how infections spread in hospitals.

what: list of preventive measures like red soap, white handkerchiefs
explanation: But the recommended practices are misleading; health experts told AFP there is no scientific basis for many of the claims, which include using red-coloured soap and white handkerchiefs, as well as obtaining specific light bulbs.

what: indian govt distributing free face masks
explanation: However, the claim is false; the Indian government said there is no such scheme in place and the linked website is not an official government site.

what: seven 'evil' things that COVID 19 is 'afraid' of
explanation: The claim is misleading; health experts say such practices are only effective when applied properly and can even be harmful if used incorrectly.

what: Claim that coronavirus stays in the throat 4 days before reaching the lungs and that gargling lukewarm water with vinegar and salt can kill it
explanation: neither water temperature, salt, nor vinegar has any impact on the coronavirus, according to experts interviewed by the AFP and recommendations from WHO and health authorities in several countries.

what: israel alleged to have developed covid-19 vaccine
explanation: The claim is misleading; the image used to illustrate a vial of the new drug is originally a stock picture while the MIGAL Research Institute in Israel, despite having a head start,  continues to work on a vaccine for COVID-19.

what: claim that unhcr said 'migrants and illegals' in malaysia were restiting covid-19 testing
explanation: The claim is false; UNHCR officials in Malaysia said the alleged statement is fake and condemned the erroneous claim for stoking “unnecessary fear and distrust”.

what: photo claiming it shows a sri lankan airlines pilot who tested positive for the novel coronavirus
explanation: The claim is false; the local health authority told AFP the pilot is not pictured in the photo; the man wrongly identified in the posts denied the claim.

what: A message shared on WhatsApp and Facebook claims that 15 coronavirus cases were linked to Burnaby’s Metrotown mall, in the western Canadian province of British Columbia.
explanation: This is false; provincial health officials and the mall administrator told AFP that no cases are connected to the mall to date.

what: "They create diseases to offer vaccines. There is already a patent for an attenuated coronavirus"
explanation: The Pirbright Institute has a patent for an attenuated form of a different strain of coronavirus, the infectious bronchitis virus (IBV). It only affects poultry

what: "Coronavirus in China: more than 30 million quarantined, 2.8 million infected; 112,000 dead! People falling on the streets and trains! Supermarkets without food! - Hal Turner Radio Show"
explanation: "No official source has confirmed these numbers. There were 81 dead and 2,840 cases confirmed until January 27th. Hal Turner never worked at the FBI. He was only an informer"

what: Coronavirus pacient bites doctor's jugular in the USA
who: multiple accounts on Facebook and Twitter
explanation: The screenshot was doctored. O Globo never published the story, URL directs to a non-related story, URL was shortened with a t.co domain, whereas O Globo uses glo.bo in their tweets

what: The Chinese company Ruilan Bao Hu San Biotech Limited is the origin of the novel Coronavirus. Its logo resemble the Umbrella Corporation, from Resident Evil
explanation: The company is based in Shanghai, 840 km away from Wuhan. Virus origin still unknown

what: Video of Wuhan market where the new coronavirus started to spread
explanation: Video is from a market in Indonesia

what: Photo of several people lying on the ground in the middle of the street, allegedly in China
explanation: Photo from Frankfurt, Germany, 2014

what: "How to prevent the coronavirus (...) Drink fennel tea twice a day. Fennel tea has the same component as Tamiflu medicine, used to treat H1N1"
explanation: Fennel tea doesn't has the same component as Tamiflu and Tamiflu is not recommended by WHO to treat the new coronavirus

what: A case of the novel coronavirus was registered in a hospital in Maranhão
explanation: It was a different type of coronavirus, HCoV-OC43, which causes regular colds

what: Market in China where bats and snakes were served as food
explanation: The market was in Indonesia (NOT the same video we checked last week!)

what: Doctors confirm that novel coronavirus may arrive in Brazil through AliExpress packages
explanation: There's no evidence for this claim. All specialists agree that it's very unlikely that a virus would survive more than a few hours outside a host, on a solid surface

what: Research shows that parts of the HIV genetic code have been inserted to the new coronavirus
explanation: Researchers from India indeed claim to have found HIV genetic sequences on the novel coronavirus, and speculate that it might indicate the new virus was artificially created. Nonetheless, these genetic sequences can be found in many different viruses, including some other strains of coronavirus. The paper, which was not peer reviewed, has been debunked by a wide array of researchers

what: Satelite images show increase in SO2 emissions around Wuhan
explanation: Images were actually from a weather forecast, based on historical data and meteorological conditions. No use of real-time data

what: "Once more the Simpsons predict the future!! - Year 1993 season 4 chapter 21 - Coronavirus"
explanation: The frames were taken from different episodes - about the Osaka flu and the housecat flu. One of them was digitally manipulated to include the word "coronavirus".

what: Vinegar is more effective than alcohol-based hand sanitizers for killing the novel coronavirus
explanation: Vinegar is not effective as a hand sanitizer. Its effects on breaking up the fat protection around viruses are very limited. Meanwhile, alcohol and soap are very effective on breaking up this protection

what: Vitamin C and warm water with lemon are effective ways of preventing Covid-19
explanation: Vitamin C has no know effect on the novel coronavirus, and neither does warm water with lemon

what: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer can influence in breathlizer test
explanation: Spreading alcohol-based hand sanitizer does not affect the breathilizer test

what: Warm drinks kill the Coronavirus, the virus dies when the ambient temperature is higher than 26ºC, gagling warm water helps treating the disease and the virus stays on your hands for 10 minutos
explanation: None of this claims have any scientific support

what: You can self-diagnose Covid-19 by holding your breath for ten seconds, avoid Covid-19 by drinking water constantly. Also, Covid-19 causes fibrosis in the lungs
explanation: None of this is true. Covid-19 does not cause lung fibrosis, which renders the "hold your breath" argument senseless. Also, drinking water constantly does not help you to avoid it

what: Cuba developed a coronavirus vaccine
who: Olho Aberto PR and other media
explanation: Cuban medication has been used for treating Covid-19 in China, but it is not a vaccine and the substance has been discovered elsewhere

what: Water boiled with garlic cures coronavirus
explanation: There's no scientific evidence of that

what: Israel has already developed a vaccine against Covid-19
explanation: Migal Galilee Research Institute, in Israel, is currently one of many labs trying to develop a vaccine agaisnt Covid-19. They claim their vaccine might be ready for tests in 8-10 weeks

what: Avoid drinking cold water during the pandemic; be exposed to sunlight
explanation: Neither is provent to have any effect on the disease

what: Universal Church of the Kingdom of God is selling R$ 500 "blessed" hand-sanitizer bottles
explanation: The image was digitally altered to include fake information and the Universal church logo

what: Preta Gil was singing in a carnival "bloco" while infected with coronavirus
explanation: She very likely caught the coronavirus seven days after her last public concert, while singing at a wedding that has become a major hub of Covid-19 dissemination. On March 1st, date of her last public concert, there were still only two cases confirmed in the country

what: Rodrigo Maia, president of the lower house of the Congress, voted a law that forbids the president to close borders
explanation: The law doesn't turn difficult to close borders, because it is about migrants rights. And Maia didn't vote "yes" for it.

what: "Coronavirus victims are buried in the morning this Wednesday in Italy. Rest in peace"
explanation: The image was taken in 2013 by Tullio M. Puglia, for Getty Images. The coffins were used for the bodies of african refugees that died on a shipwreck near Lampedusa, south Italy.

what: Netflix is offering free access to anyone in Brazil during the coronavirus crisis
explanation: Netflix is not offering free services during the pandemic. The URL used is not a Netflix domain

what: Petrobras (Brazil largest oil company) is closing its refinaries from March 24th onwards
explanation: The alledged press release did not come from Petrobras. Refinaries are not going to be shut down for now

what: A man claims his dog was vaccinated for coronavirus, thus the SARS-Cov-2 is not really a new virus
explanation: Canine coronavirus (CCov) and the novel coronavirus are not the same virus

what: Uber will suspend operations for 10 days due to the pandemic
explanation: The alledged announcement did not come from Uber, and the company will not stop working during the crisis

what: Elderly people who are caught wandering outside will have their pensions cancelled by the government
explanation: INSS (government body responsible for paying the pensions to retirees) says no such measure has been considered

what: Photos of Maju Coutinho (a well known Brazilian journalist) walking around in Leblon beach with her boyfriend, even though she is urging people to stay inside during the pandemic
explanation: Pictures are from 2019

what: Burglars are *disguising as health agents* to invade and rob apartment buildings in Belo Horizonte and Goiânia
explanation: Police forces from Goiás and Minas Gerais deny these occurrances

what: Atacadão (supermarket chain) is distributing goods for free. Coment this post and you might get them
explanation: This is a scam used for acquiring Facebook logins and passwords

what: Chinese pet owners are killing their cats and dogs by throwing them out of the window, in fear of their pets spreading the coronavirus. This, after memos were issued by authorities for pet owners to get rid of their animals.
explanation: The pet killings happened withtin the context of the Chinese local authorities issuing REAL memos that ordered citizens to get rid of their pets and the dissemination of the misinformation about the transmission of the coronavirus 2019-nCoV, but we cannot affirm that the motivation of the owners of the animals has been related to the disease outbreak .

what: Pinol cleaner is the solution to coronavirus
explanation: Covid-19 was discovered at the end of 2019 and cleaners have not proven its effectiveness against this virus.

what: drinking hot water prevents the Covid-19
explanation: This information is false, health authorities do not recognize hot water as a preventive measure and experts point out that it could be counterproductive.

what: Video of 'coronavirus patient' persecuted by the press is not from Mexico
explanation: The video was recorded on February 18 at the Instituto Nacional Cardiopulmonar, Tórax de Honduras

what: Telephone to request that the Mexican government go to your home to do a Covid-19 test
explanation: The UIES line was enabled only for suspicious cases and not for the general population.

what: holding your breath without coughing will not tell you if you have COVID-19
explanation: False, having difficulty breathing is a feature of any respiratory illness and not a sign of coronavirus

what: in Spain dozens of people faced beatings and shoves with the police because they prevented them from going to a mass to pray against COVID-19.
explanation: The video has nothing to do with the coronavirus, nor with the state of alert decreed in Spain. In fact, when the video was originally released on October 14 last year, there were still no reports of COVID-19 existing in the world.

what: European and South American flights cause chaos at Mexico Airport, due to coronavirus
explanation: The video was recorded in December and is not related to COVID-19.

what:
A mixture of vinegar and
fabric softener is a better desinfectant than alcohol
explanation: Even when vinegar and quaternary ammonium included in some fabric softeners do have some antibacterial properties, its mixture is not more effective than alcohol in innactivating viruses and killing bacteria. This mixture is not included in the official reccomendations to fight Covid-19.

what: A video shows a family killed by the coronavirus amid China’s multi-city lockdown
who: Users on Weibo, YouTube, FB, WhatsApp
explanation: False: The video does not show a family killed by the coronavirus amid China’s multi-city lockdown. The family was reported to have died of carbon monoxide poisoning in Dec 2019.

what: A map shows hundreds of thousands of Wuhan residents (or even 5 million of them) traveling out of the city before the lockdown
who: Tweet by a research group at University of Southampton. Later many news outlets in UK and Australia
explanation: The map is merely “an illustrative picture of the global air network” that shows international flight connections.

what: Charts claiming to show the difference among COVID19, flu, common cold
explanation: Charts include inaccurate information about symptoms. They claim people suffering from the novel coronavirus do not develop some symptoms seen in flu or common cold patients, such as a runny or stuffy nose, a sore throat, vomiting, diarrhea and muscle pain, among others -- most of which can actually be seen among COVID-19 patients as well.

what: A video showing an anti-China protest amid the COVID-19 outbreak in Italy
explanation: The video show a march in Rome to commemorate the 40th anniversary of the assassination of Valerio Verbano, an Italian left-wing activist murdered in 1980.

what: Vidoe shows a WHO official inappropriately touching a female attendee during a briefing session in China about the novel coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan. Same video was also used with another cliam that the man is an Australian politician.
explanation:
Video was taken out of context. The man in the video is a 2006 Nobel Prize laureate in physics, Professor George Smoot, not someone from WHO or a politician.
The clip shows Smoot attending a business conference in Julu County in Hebei Province in China in June 2018 with his significant other who was having a sore back at the time.

what: Coronavirus may have spread due to the consumption of bat soup, according to scientists
explanation: There is no evidence to support the claim that the consumption of bat soup is connected to the transmisson of the 2019-nCoV. One recent study indicates that the new virus does share genetic information with other kinds of coroviruses that infect bats, but it is still unclear which animals may have transmitted the virus to humans. Analysing a genetic database, researchers concluded that chinese snakes are the most likely reservoir for the new pathogen, but the hypothesis has yet to be tested experimentally.

what: WHO advises population to avoid having unprotected sex with animals
who: Facebook personal profilles and WhatsApp groups
explanation: Posts presented an edited version of an image posted by WHO on Twitter in January 27. In the original publication, the organization advised people to avoid contact with wild and farm animals.

what: Doctors reccomend vitamin C and fennel seed tea to help avoid the novel Coronavirus
explanation: There is no scientific evidence to support the claim that vitamin C or fennel seed tea are effective in the treatment or prevention of the novel coronavirus

what: Vitamin C with Zinc helps prevent and treat the coronavirus infection
explanation: According to WHO, there is still no remedy to treat the 2019-nCoV virus and preventive measures include washing your hands frequently and avoiding contact with infected people, not taking vitamin C with zinc.

what: Canadian Department of Health issues emergency notification that asks population to keep their throats moisty against coronavirus
explanation: The bulletin is false and there is no scientific evidence that shows that drinking water prevents against coronavirus.

what: A image from the ship Costa Fascinosa with a message claiming that it was in Búzios and had 3.500 italians that left Europe after the Italy lockout.
explanation: The photo that has been shared with the misinformation piece is from the Costa Fascinosa cruise, and the company responsible for the vessel reported that all of its passengers in Brazil are from South America. The ship left Italy on November 17, 2019, has passed through France and Spain and has been on the Brazilian coast since December 2, two months before Italy confirmed its first coronavirus case.

what: Post that claims drinking water and gargling with salt or vinegar eliminate the virus from the throath
explanation: According to the brazilian Ministry of Health and experts consulted by Aos Fatos, this information is untrue and may even worsen the patient's condition. Publications circulating on social media with misleading content also omit that there is still no drug or treatment to cure Covid-19.

what: Image distorts economic data to suggest China benefited from new coronavirus
explanation: Contrary to what the piece of misinformation suggests, the country's stock exchanges have suffered from the pandemic: two of its most important indices - the CSI 300, which brings together the largest companies in the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges, and the compound Shanghai - have fallen 8% and 0.94% since the beginning of the year. In addition, the coronavirus outbreak caused a reduction in economic activity in China, with a sharp drop in industrial production and retail sales and an increase in the unemployment rate in the first two months of 2020.

what: Video and texts that claims Israel found a cure and vaccine for coronavirus
explanation: The video report shared with these posts actually shows the process of developing a vaccine that, according to the scientists in charge, may be available in May. At no time does the video claim that the drug already exists or that a cure for the infection with the new coronavirus has been found.

what: WhatsApp message that said that brazilian government released withdrawals for Bolsa Família beneficiaries because of the coronavirus
explanation: The Ministry of Citizenship, responsible for the program, denied on its social networks that there will be such a release and stated that it only announced the inclusion of 1.2 million families in Bolsa Família. In addition, messages circulating on WhatsApp with this misinformation (see here) bring links to fake websites.

what: Video shows larve extractted from person's lip is related to Coronavirus
explanation: The viral video has no relation to Coronavirus as it is an old video which can be traced back to October 2019

what: Avoid ice-creams, cold drinks, and sweets for 90 days to prevent Coronavirus
explanation: No scientific backing to say that the virus spreads through food items like ice creams and cold drinks. The virus has not even emerged in India.

what: A Facebook video claiming that a seafood market place is the Wuhan market in China
explanation: This video is of the Langowan market in Indonesia and not of the Wuhan seafood market.

what: That the Coronavirus is patented by Pirbright University
explanation: Coronaviruses are a group of similar looking viruses. The patent by Pirbright University is for the Avian Infectious bronchitis virus (IBV) which is found in fowls, pheasants and turkeys. This patent is not linked to the current 2019-novel Coronavirus

what: That the health department has issued a notification to drink only 50-80cc of water, avoid spicy food, and not travel in crowded spaces till March 2020
explanation: There has been no notification suggesting drinking only a certain amount of water, avoiding spicy food and improving the intake of vitamin C prevent Coronavirus. The children are more vulnerable theory is also not scientifically backed. At the time of the story, there were no confirmed cases in India and the death toll had reached 106 in China

what: Video of a girl dying of Coronavirus in a shopping mall
explanation: The video is from Malaysia where the girl died due to a heart failure and not Coronvirus. BOOM corroborated the theory with a family member of the deceased

what: Corpses strewn in China due to Coronavirus
explanation: The image is from Frankfurt, Germany from 2014 where people lay down in a pedestrian zone as part of an art project in remembrance of the 528 victims of the "Katzback" Nazi concentration camp

what: Garlic water prevents the recent Coronavirus as proved by an old Chinese doctor
explanation: The WHO has not prescribed any methods and garlic is a known antidote for colds but there is no link with the recent Coronavirus

what: Hubei district is filled with bats on their roofs which are the main source of Coronavirus thus the virus spread there
explanation: The video is an 8 year old video from Miami Florida and is not linked to the Coronavirus

what: Government of India recommends Homeopathy and other alternate medicines for preventing Coronavirus
explanation: THe World Health Organization has stated that there are no proved preventions and treatments for this virus. The mechanisms mentioned by the AYUSH ministry are not scientifically proved to help in tackling Coronaviruses

what: Broiler chickens were found to have coronavirus in Mumbai
explanation: Chickens have not been identified as the source for the Coronavirus so far and the attached pictures are not linked to Coronavirus

what: Pigs mulled in China blamed for coronavirus
explanation: The video is from the African swine flu outbreak in China in 2018/19

what: In surgical masks, the white filter side is supposed to be worn outside and the colored on the inside
explanation: Only the coloured side of the surgical mask is to be worn outside and N95 masks are better than these normal surgical masks.

what: Xi Jin Ping visits mosque for coronavirus
explanation: BOOM found that the video is from July 2016

what: China asks for permission to kill 20000 infected cases
explanation: The website is renowned to share misinformation. There is no evidence for China asking for the same

what: Videos stating that 25,000 Chinese are being killed
explanation: Three different videos - 2 unrelated to the Coronavirus and one with overlaid music wre clubbed together with false claims

what: The Chinese PM visited a mosque to protect for Coronavirus
explanation: The video is of the then Malaysian PM of 2015 visiting a mosque in Beijing China

what: Dettol kills Coronavirus and the company knew about the existence of the virus before the outbreak of the virus in China
explanation: Dettol kills older strains of Coronavirus but has not tested the new strain yet. Coronavirus is a family of strains infecting mammals and humans

what: Indian daily falsely links study to Coronavirus in digital edition and then changes it.
explanation: The study was linked to filoviruses and had the minimal role of Wuhan's virology institute

what: Asterix and Simpsons predicted the Coronavirus outbreak
explanation: Coronavirus has been around since the 1960s while the Simpsons picture was edited.

what: Weed kills coronavirus
explanation: The news clip was created through a meme generator while the WHO has stated that there are no proved cures for the virus yet

what: People were screaming in Wuhan because of the fear of Coronavirus
explanation: The video is actually of Wuhan residents whistling and shouting to commemorate Dr. Li Wenliang, the whistleblower of the virus who died on February 7 after getting infected.

what: Telangana Ministry distributed homeopathic tablets claimed to prevent COVID=19
explanation: BOOM could not find any scientific evidence supporting theory that arsenicum album prevents Coronavirus- Follow up to AYUSH story

what: Drinking alcohol kills Coronavirus
explanation: Drinking alcohol does not cure Coronavirus, alcohol in sanitizers does have an effect

what: Chinese SWAT Team takes down a Coronavirus suspect
explanation: A mock drill video was shared as China committing atrocites on its patients

what: Indian Government and World Health Organization advised people to not purchase colours from China for Holi
explanation: No such advisory was shared by the government or the Ministry

what: A Shaheen Bagh protestor was claimed to have Coronavirus
explanation: BOOM contacted hospitals in Delhi and confirmed that no Shaheen Bagh protestor had tested positive for COVID-19

what: Chinese President Xi Jin Ping visited Muslims to understand why Muslims are not contracting COVID-19
explanation: BOOM found that the viral video is a combination of three clips of Xi Jinping visiting the northwest region of China in 2016.

what: Video shows reciting Namaaz and Quran can only be the treatment of pandemic COVID-19.
explanation: BOOM looked at the video and found several indications about it being a 'Viral Test', Aaj Tak's show where it debunks false claims.

what: UNICEF Advises a certain set of steps to follow for Coronavirus
explanation: UNICEF has not released this advisory and most of the claims are not scientificlly backed

what: News channels suggests drinking tulsi and noni juice will help prevent the Novel Coronavirus,
explanation: A morphed screenshot of the news channel was used

what: Israel and USA have come up with a vaccine
explanation: Israel has found a vaccine with properties similar to COVID-19, San Diego had developed an algorithm

what: "A Chinese, who was conveyed from Kansai airport (in Osaka) to hospital, has run away before the virus testing"
explanation: According to the Kansai Airport Quarantine Station, this information is absolutely false.

what: New coronavirus information "15% fatality rate, 83% infection rate" and "the worst mankind in human history"
explanation: According to Ministry of Health, this information is absolutely false.

what: A tweet entitled "Risk of novel coronavirus and countermeasures" saying "The virus stays alive for 48 hours." "The clothes need to be disinfected with alcohol and goggles to prevent corneal infection." "Die without fever."
explanation: Acording to the Virology Expert; Inactivation will not take 48 hours. No cases have been reported of death without fever. It is difficult to completely disinfect outerwear with alcohol. Goggles are not generally needed. Not an artificial virus.

what: "It’s Democrat’s fault that health insurance system is abused by foreigners"
explanation: Accoring to Japan Tourism Agency, this information is false.

what: "The truth of the coronavirus that is not transmitted in Japan; "Homicide virus weapon" "Dies if infected"."
explanation: The Washington Times article does not provide any evidence. According to the CDC, the source of the new coronavirus is currently likely to be wildlife. The mortality rate is currently 2-3%. Most of the dead are elderly people or those with underlying illnesses such as diabetes.

what: "Chinese rush to Japan to abuse Japanese health insurance system."
explanation: According to Ministy of Health, this information is mostly false.

what: "Taiwanese print Taiwan flag on masks to prevent Chinese from buying up"
explanation: Production of the mask with the national flag started at the latest in 2019. There is no relationship with this coronavirus. Posts posted as "jokes" on Taiwanese Internet bulletin boards have spread.

what: "4600 Chinese arrived to Hakata Port"
explanation: According to Hakata-city, this information is misleading.

what: "Scientists found unique inserts in the 2019-nCoV HIV protein"
explanation: There is some similarity between the new coronavirus and the proteins of HIV, this is only accidental, saying that "similar sequences can be found in many organisms."

what: "Tokyo Olympic Games 2020 will be canceled because of coronavirus."
explanation: According to The Tokyo Organising Committee of the Olympic and Paralympic Games, this information is false

what: "Kochi Prefectural Assembly, who returned from Wuhan, refused the test, but as a result of the test in the prefecture, it was infected with coronavirus"
explanation: No coronavirus infection has been confirmed in Kochi Prefecture, and no tests have been carried out.

what: China officially said that the new coronavirus had "confirmed aerosol infection" and that "in short, airborne infections" was spread.
explanation: Aerosol infections are rare and different from airborne infections.

what: On Twitter, there was a post criticized against Okinawa Prefecture Governor Tamaki Denny with a video of Kachashi dancing with the mayor of Nanjo City.It was reported that "the governor and the mayor danced while the people terrified about the new coronavirus infection."
explanation: It is true that Governor Tamaki danced Kachashi with Mayor Zukeran in January 25.But this is before the cruise ship anchored in Naha.

what: Twitter posts spread with attached images.This is map image that “based on traces of Wuhan citizen”,during the period between the outbreak of the new coronavirus and the blockade of Wuhan.
explanation: This map is an image showing the routes of passenger aircraft around the world, and it is incorrect to use "maps based on traces of movement"

what: A  large amount of sulfur dioxide was observed in Wuhan and if the body was incinerated, it would be worth 14,000.
explanation: The source of the information is "Windy.com", but even if the body was burned, "Windy.com" does not show real-time sulfur dioxide.

what: If the new coronavirus test is negative, the cost is 80,000 yen. If positive, the state will bear the cost.
explanation: No voluntary testing of the new coronavirus has been performed. The test is "when it is determined that the prefecture is necessary based on travel history and contact history with patients", but in this case, the test cost is public expense regardless of negative or positive, and it is "free".

what: Video shows pigs buried alive
explanation: This video if from January 2019

what: This video shows corpses on the streets of Wuhahn
explanation: It is in Shenzhen and shows people coming from Hubei sleeping in the streets because no one wants to rent them a rool

what: The Covid-19 has been invented by a big French public medical institute (Institut Pasteur)
who: Viral video of an unknown man
explanation: Big confusion between the 2003 coronavirus and the Covid-19.

what: The military is coming to Paris because of the virus
explanation: Normal military movements ; nothing to do with the covid

what: The military is coming to Paris because of the virus (bis)
explanation: Normal military movements ; nothing to do with the covid

what: Tencent revealed the real numbers of dead
explanation: We have no proof the screenshot is true. However, it seems really unlikely.

what: The ice skating rink in Mulhouse has been requisitioned for use as a morgue
explanation: The rink is not used to stock dead bodies.

what: An official decree taken by the government says the military will have to help in the hospitals
who: French community on Twitter and Facebook
explanation: The text is just a transposition of an old law into a decree - and has nothing to do with the coronavirus

what: Hundreds of Italian families are running away from the virus to Africa
explanation: We have no proof of this assertion

what: Drink hot tea can prevent from catching COVID-19
explanation: Drinking hot tea has no effect on Covid-19

what: A video supposedly showing Italiens or French people singing Madonna, Katy Perry, Britney Spears or Aya Nakamura on their balcony because of the lockdown measure in France and Italy
who: Madonna official Twitter account, Katy Perry official Twitter account etc.
explanation: The video was shot in Torino (Italy) and people are singing and dancing La Macarana

what: This video of a person infected with Coronavirus being detained by the police is not real, it´s a drill

what: Argentine President Alberto Fernández said that Coronavirus dies at 26 degrees celsius
who: Alberto Fernández (Argentine President) on Radio Mitre
explanation:
The WHO maintains that the virus can be transmitted in all climatic areas and that "the virus is too new for us to know how a warmer climate could affect transmissibility".
According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), it is not yet known whether climate and temperature affect the spread of COVID-19. There is still no scientific consensus on the impact of room temperature on this particular virus.

what: Argentine President Alberto Fernández said that "the WHO recomended to drink hot drinks because heat kills the virus" (about Coronavirus)
who: Alberto Fernández (Argentine President) on Radio Mitre
explanation:
The organization did not issue any recommendation on the consumption of beverages for the prevention of Coronavirus.
Experts deny this advice and even say that it could be harmful. This version circulates on social media and WhatsApp in Argentina and in other countries.

what: COVID-19 was created in 2014 by an English institute.
explanation:
A viral video denounces that the Pirbright Institute, of the United Kingdom, created that year the virus that causes COVID-19.
The institute denied the rumors, noting that the virus strain they work with to make a vaccine is different from the new Coronavirus: it does not affect humans.

what: vitamin C and lemon water prevent Coronavirus.
explanation:
There is no recommendation from the World Health Organization or scientific evidence to support this.
There is also no vaccine or medicine to prevent the disease yet.

what: two local celebrities are infected with Coronavirus
explanation: Fake twitter accounts claimed they had contracted the virus. The celebrities denied the disinformation

what: Argentine Health Minister said that there was no possibility that the Coronavirus exists in Argentina
explanation: In January, González García suggested that at that time "there is no possibility that there is Coronavirus in Argentina", and that, if there was a case in the country, it would be imported, which actually happened.

what: Nostradamus predicted Coronavirus
explanation:
In the book Prophecies of Nostradamus it doen´t say any of the words that are now being spread.
The prophecies that record the words "plague" and "dust" are different from the one that circulates in the image that went viral.

what: The viral image of people lying on the street related to coronavirus
explanation: The image was taken in Germany during an event commemorating the victims of the Nazi concentration camp in Katzbach.

what: Christine Lagarde said: "The elderly live too long and that is a risk to the global economy"
explanation:
There are no written or audiovisual records of the former IMF director saying the statements attributed to her.
In addition, the European Central Bank -inquired by Maldita- assured that Lagarde had not said that phrase.
Part of the phrase attributed to the president of the European Central Bank (ECB) comes from a 2012 report by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in whose presentation Lagarde was not present.

explanation:

The company denied that the audio was recorded by the president of the company.

what: Recommendations of Dr. "González Ayala" circulating on WhatsApp
explanation:
Dr. Silvia González Ayala denied that she was the author of the recommendations and said that she will file a criminal complaint.
Furthermore, the text has several false claims.

explanation: specialists emphasize that the comparison is misleading because it is a new virus that is still spreading and has not reached its "maximum circulation" like the other diseases mentioned

what: ibuprofen enhances the coronavirus
explanation:

Initially, he recommended the use of acetaminophen to treat symptoms, but later clarified that he was "not aware of reports of any negative effects" of ibuprofen.

explanation: Today, March 17, China announced that a possible vaccine will undergo human testing. But it is still missing so that it can begin to occur "on a large scale", as several media headlined. China still has no coronavirus vaccine list (Covid-19)

what: the “coronavirus, before reaching the lungs, remains in the throat for four days” and that “gargling with hot water and salt or vinegar will eliminate the virus”.
explanation: The SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus does not "stay four days" in the throat, and gargling with water and salt is not an effective method of preventing the Covid-19 disease that it produces.

what: There is a study that establishes the relationship between ibuprofen and the severity of the virus infection. . . apparently what Ibuprofen does is facilitate the reproduction of the virus "

Some social network users even shared the video as if this were Putin's response to the handling that other countries have given to the coronavirus outbreak.

explanation: It is possible that animals transmitted the virus to people. Many of the first patiens had visited the market. However, a direct link has not yet been proven.

what: China orders citizens to abandon/kill their pets as they can transmit Coronavirus

The WHO says that right now there is no evidence that the virus can be transmitted through pets.

what: 37.000 US soldiers are entering the EU while everybody is busy with the coronavirus, the soldiers are immune
explanation: the Nato exercise Defender Europe 20 is no secret exercise, there are only 29.000 US soldiers and media reported about it for months. Further, it was stopped because of the Coronavirus outbreak - soldiers are not immune

what: A video shows an Italian doctor who says that nobody died only from Coronavirus in Italy, that it's not more dangerous than a flu
explanation: the video is from February when there were only 11 deaths by Coronavirus in Italy. It is not possible to say whether people with prior diseases die only because of the virus. But studies show that also healthy people died so far

what: Although Germany closes its borders refugees and migrants may still come in and they will not be medically checked for Coronavirus
explanation: Asylum seekers may under certain circumstances still come to Germany, but they are not the only persons allowed to cross the border. And there will be medical checks if they are infected

what: WHO says Coronavirus might be spread via food
explanation: The WHO has no hints so far that infections with Coronavirus via food are possible.

what: QQ accidentally showed that the real death toll is 25,000 people

what: The virus was created by humans and patented
explanation: The patents exist but are not for the current coronavirus

what: Chinese scientists expelled from a Canadian microbiology lab took the coronavirus with them to China
explanation: The two scientists at the National Microbiology Lab (Winnipeg, Canada) are suspected to have sent live Ebola and Henipah viruses to Beijing in March 2019, but it has nothing to do with the coronavirus. They were expelled from the lab, but are not considered spies.

what: The common flu kills 60 times more people annually than Corona
explanation: It is not right to compare common flu to Corona virus because influenza is seasonal virus, we have vaccines for it and the virus is predictable whereas while this new corona virus exists only for few months and nobody could say exactly what is mortality rate from this virus. Even compared to current information about Coronavirus fatality rate, it comes much higher (around 2-3 percent) than common flu (0.01 percent)

what: 156 thousand people died in China due to Coronavirus, 90 thousand in Wuhan itself
explanation: Article was based on Russian YouTube video, which was based on another article written by infamous conspiracy fake-news website. Figures had no reliable source of information.

what: Gates Foundation funded development of Coronavirus

what: Satellite images showing high levels of sulphur dioxide above China are possible evidence of mass cremations of people who have died from coronavirus.
explanation: This is forecast based on historical data. Full Fact analysis was mentioned in our article.

what: People who are not insured have to pay for medical test for coronavirus, so if they can't afford it, they will spread it.
explanation: He included a document from hospital which named the price for voluntary coronavirus test, for those who are not suspected of having coronavirus (they haven't been to affected areas nor they have medical signs of disease). Anyone who IS suspected of having coronavirus, will have medical examination free of charge, no matter if he's insured or not.

what: World labs confirm: coronavirus was bioengineered.
explanation: There is no evidence.

explanation: Article has clearly misleading, false headline that is obvious clickbait: "Prime minister has no doubts: Coronavirus epidemy in Poland". In the article itself there is no claim or statement said by any of Polish officials that could justify such alarming headline.

what: Fake coronavirus pandemic is a cover-up for the "5g disease"

explanation: Information was published without verification and was denied afterwards.

what: An image showing "Spanish biologist" who claimed that footballers which earn millions of euros should research the cure for coronavirus

explanation: It won't help you in detecting coronavirus.

who: Various Fb posts, article on a website
explanation: 15 years is maximum potential punishment (from 7 up to 15 years of imprisonment) but not for those who break the quarantine but for those infected who willingly spread contagious disease and it will be proven to result in death of other people.

what: A CBC news report would have said that Chinese scientists from a Canadian lab sent the coronavirus to Wuhan

what: 3 preliminary studies who became viral on social networks for wrong reasons
explanation: Those are 3 authentic publications, but they were either too preliminary to conclude what they were concluding, or social networks overstated their conclusions.

what: Facebook user alleged coronavirus is unknown and kills in seconds
explanation: The coronavirus is not unknown nor does it kill ‘under a few seconds.’ The WHO says the virus is part of a family of viruses that includes Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS-CoV) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS-CoV). Also, fatality and severity of the disease may be determined by age and other pre-existing health conditions.

what: Facebook page suggests a bowl of garlic cures "Wuhans" coronavirus.
explanation: Health authorities have not recommended any particular drug for coronavirus. So, suggesting an alternative medical practice(s) such as eating a bowl of boiled garlic water is questionable.

what: Twitter user posts viral image suggesting that cocaine kills coronavirus.
explanation: The World Health Authority has said there is no that there is currently no specific medicine to prevent or treat the new coronavirus. Moreso, relevant authorities stance is in contradiction to the viral headline.

what: China seeks approval from the court to kill over 20 000 coronavirus patients
explanation: There are a few inadequacies detected on the source’s website. Also, zero credible news platforms have published this claim. All these make the claim unsubstantial.

what: Article suggests African skin and blood is resistant to coronavirus.
explanation: There is no evidence to suggest “black people’s” immunity to the virus, or conversely “white people’s” vulnerability to it. The World Health Organisation (WHO) already stated that anyone in proximity to an infected person is at risk of contracting it (COVID-19).

what: Ibrahim Magu, Acting EFCC Chairman attributed corruption as the reason for Coronavirus.
explanation: Coronavirus recently named Covid-19 by the World Health Organisation is a disease. Further, health authorities surmise it emanated from the wet markets in China; being a zoonotic disease. And while the jury’s out on the full clinical picture for Covid-19’s, no evidence suggests it to be a function of moral misconduct or the activities of corrupt individuals.

what: Social media posts claim Chloroquine, an antimalarial drug can cure  #COVID19
explanation: No health authorities have certified Chloroquine as a cure for coronavirus. WHO, the foremost authority on the subject, according to the Director-General of the body, Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, says while the organisation is currently conducting a number of drug trials, it does not expect a result before three weeks. More so, the “malarial Chloroquine used in China was not one of the drugs.”

what: A Twitter page claimed shaving of facial hair ensures safety from COVID-19, further attributing the message to the CDC.
explanation: Results from our research show that the message from Today.ng's article is a misappropriation of a 2017 NOISH publication; a notification directed at workers using respirators in carrying out their tasks. It has nothing to do with preventing the spread of coronavirus.

what: Coronavirus has not "hit" Ghana
explanation: While there are reports of two suspects exhibiting symptoms of the said virus, both men tested negative. This is according to Dr Asare, the Chief Executive Officer of Korle-Bu Teaching Hospital.

what: Constant sex kills coronavirus
explanation: Sex cannot kill or cure coronavirus, the science does not add up. Rather such close contact with an infected person will expose the partner to the disease.

what: Viral picture message suggests Obasanjo said that there is no coronavirus in Nigeria and that the mister of health lied.
explanation: President Obasanjo's spokesperson, Kehinde Akinyemi refuted allegations attributed to Baba; a moniker often used to describe the former head of state. Additionally, Dubawa initiated a google reverse image search, which revealed that the "Fox News writer" (the source) used the image out of context.

what: Twitter users said Adutwumwaa Bitters cures coronavirus.
explanation: Adumtwumwaa Bitters does not cure coronavirus. Producers of the medicine, Adumtwumwaa Herbal Industries Limited, have emphatically stated that their product cannot and does not cure the deadly virus. The World Health Organization (WHO) says there’s no cure, vaccine or specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat coronavirus at the moment.

what: A health expert surmised that the SARS-Cov2 virus might not spread in Nigeria due to hot temperature.
explanation: Warmer air holds more moisture; thus preventing airborne viruses from travelling as far as they would in dry air. Still, the jury’s out on whether or not SARS-Cov2 will be resistant or vulnerable to hot temperature.

what: Viral video suggests the two cases of coronavirus in Ghana tested negative.
explanation: The video is not new. It was part of a news item published by Citi TV on February 6, 2020, when two suspected cases tested negative.

what: Viral post suggests Dettol can kill coronavirus
explanation: Dettol has been tested on, and found to kill coronaviruses such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS). However, the manufacturer of Dettol, Reckitt Benckiser Group plc(RB), says it has not yet tested its products on the novel coronavirus and could not confirm whether Dettol is effective against the new coronavirus strain.

what: A Facebook post suggests that drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the coronavirus.
explanation: The claim has not been corroborated by any health institution. The WHO says there is currently no specific treatment, drug or vaccine for the Covid-19, although some home remedies may provide comfort and alleviate symptoms.

what: China builds a hospital in 48 hours for Coronavius patients

A dedicated work force made the empty building into a fully operational hospital within two days, which was mistaken as the Huoshenshan Hospital proposed to be constructed in 6 days. Huoshenshan hospital is still under construction and is expected to open to the patients on 3rd day of February.

what: Banglore Muncipal body (BBMP) will be *spraying medicine in the air* to kill Coronavirus.

what: After Covid19 outbreak in europe Muslims and Non Muslims have come out in the streets shouting praises for allah and reading Kalma

what: Muslim People in China seeking refuge in Islam by reading Quran to save themselves from COVID-19

what: Japanese doctors claim Drinking Water Every 15 Minute Prevent COVID-19
explanation: There is no Japanese advisory issued regarding frequent consumption of water. World Health Organization has clarified , that drinking water will not prevent a Coronavirus infection.

what: Cocaine Cures COVID-19
explanation: There is still no vaccine or medical treatment available or discovered for COVID-19. Cocaine certainly is not a cure for Coronavirus as it is a stimulant and addictive drug.

what: consuming onion and salt followed by a glass of water can cure Coronavirus
explanation: There is no scientific evidence to prove that onion, salt and water can be used to cure COVID-19. Also at present there is no cure for Coronavirus.

what: Anti-Malaria Drug Chloroquine Is  A Cure For Coronavirus
explanation: Anti- Malaria drug Chloroquine is not an authorized medicine to cure Coronavirus. There is no scientific evidence to prove that Chloroquine can be used to cure COVID-19.

what: Indian Ministry of Health and Family Welfare as issued an office memorandum declaring compulsory holiday in four Indian states
explanation: Ministry of Health India has denied any such notification

what: ”WHO approves anti-Malarial drug Chloroquine for #COVID2019 "
explanation: Fact Crescendo found the details mentioned in the news published by Economic Times to be False. WHO has not declared, approved or recommended anti-malarial drug Chloroquine as a treatment medicine for COVID-19.

what: Australian researchers have found that bananas can help prevent infection of COVID-19.
explanation: We found the post to be False. There is no proof that banana can boost one’s immune system and prevent the disease caused by coronavirus. At present there are no medicines to cure COVID-19

what: hot air application through a hairdryer on the face to heat up nostrils and the sinus kills the Novel Coronavirus.
explanation: Fact Crescendo found the above-mentioned post to be False. Hot air application through a hairdryer on the face to heat up nostrils will not kill the Coronavirus.

what: Image of coffins from Italy showing carnage due to recent COVID-19 outbreak.
explanation: The image is 7 years old and is of the dead bodies of African immigrants who died while entering Italy.

what: Saddam Hussein predicted Coronavirus outbreak 40 years ago.

what: Consuming salt and onion can cure the novel coronavirus.
explanation: No research available on the topic also Sri Lankan health department officials have officialy dismissed the claim.

what: Thailand CDC announces green chiretta can cure coronavirus
explanation: No such evidence for curing Covid-19 with green chiretta is recommended by WHO or Thailand CDC

what: kitchen foods plus morning sunshine can prevent and cure coronavirus
explanation: At present there is no evidence to prove that eating kitchen foods like onion, garlic and lemondoes  prevent or cure Covid-19 and the same is not recommended by WHO

what: Viral Post claiming that covid-19 infected patient found in Sipaw township hospital
explanation: Both ministry of health and sports and Sipaw township medical superintendent have issued patient had not contracted the COVID19

what: Viral claims propogating UNICEF Message About Coronavirus
