what: Traditional Cures And Self-Checks For Coronavirus
explanation: Our fact check reveals that there is no scientific evidence to prove that drinking water washes down COVID-19 and gargling with warm water & salt or vinegar eliminates the Coronavirus. Similarly the self-check breath test for Coronavirus is absolutely baseless.

what: Coronavirus pneumonia is similar to a dry cough & Hot Weather, Garlic And Hot Water Are  Remedies for COVID19
explanation: there is no scientific proof that hot and humid weather conditions or drinking warm water and consumption of garlic, onions and other spices can prevent the spread of novel Coronavirus infection.

what: Claims Of Cures For COVID-19 From Multiple Countries
explanation: While some drugs have provided symptomatic improvement, there is no confirmation that any of the medication currently being tested across different parts of the world is a definitive cure for COVID-19. WHO officially confirms there has not been any definitive vaccine or antiviral drug developed to prevent or treat COVID-19 to date, hence all above claims are misleading.

what: IDH Hospital, main center in Sri Lanka for treating COVID19 patients, is in shortage of number of assentials.
explanation: We contacted both doctors and health officials and confirmed that there is no shortage of goods at the hospital as of yet and the messages were fabricated.

what: consuming *alcoholic beverages* may help reduce the risk of infection by the novel coronavirus; COVID-19
explanation: Drinking alcohol does not protect you from coronavirus infection, https://www.facebook.com/WHO/posts/2932801180098579

what: "Gale of the wind" and "Neem Tree" leaves are good medicine to protect from coronavirus
who: Crime news Srilanka and number of Tamil FB Users
explanation: As stated by WHO still there is no official remedy or cure for COVID-19, while some of the traditional methods have symptomatic improvements.

what: Man contacts COVID-19 by eating mutton.
explanation: Its a fake news card and the news channel has denied publishing any such news.

what: Effects of Coronovirus on an affected persons lip
explanation: The video shared a effectof Coronovirus on a patient lip is found to be on the internet at least since November-2019 i.e. before the recent epidemic broke out. So, it is not related to the recent Coronavirus epidemic.

what: 4 people died in Hyderabad (India) due to Coronavirus
explanation: No cases of Coronavirus have been reported in India

what: Ministry of health’s emergency notification to the public about Coronavirus influenza outbreak
explanation: The advisory message has not been issued by the Health Ministry. Also, in the precautions released by the Ministry, there is nothing related to keeping the throat moist.

what: Video of a girl dying of Coronavirus
explanation: The girl in the video has not died due to Coronavirus. The family of the girl and the Malaysian Health Ministry have confirmed that the rumours about the girl’s death are FALSE.

what: Video of a market in Wuhan (China), the suspected origin of the Coronavirus outbreak
explanation: The video was taken at an animal market in Langowan (Indonesia). It is not related to Wuhan (China)

what: Two ways of wearing a surgical mask: Colored side out if you are sick and White side out if you do not want to become sick.
explanation: There is only one way of wearing a three-layered surgical mask. The colored side of the surgical mask should face outwards.

what: Video of the new hospital set up by China for Coronavirus patients.
explanation: The video is found to exist on the internet at least since 2018. So, the claim that it shows the new hospital set up by China for Coronavirus patients is FALSE.

what: Xi Jinping has said that Chinese scientists found cure for Coronavirus in Cow urine
explanation: Xi Jinping did not make the statements regarding gaumutra (Cow urine) mentioned in the post

what: Image of Coronavirus victims in China
explanation: The image is from Germany and it shows people lying down in a pedestrian zone, as part of an art project in Frankfurt, in remembrance of victims of the Katzbach Nazi concentration camp.

what: Video of a family died due to novel Coronavirus.
explanation: The video was found on the internet at least since the last week of December 2019. But the first death from the novel Coronavirus was reported only in the second week of January 2020.

what: Video of Chinese Prime Minister Li Keqiang visiting a Mosque and offering prayers seeking protection to the country from Coronavirus.
explanation: The man in the video is not Chinese Prime Minister Li Keqiang, he is former Malaysian PM Abdullah Ahmad Badawi. The video was taken in 2015 and it shows Badawi visiting ‘Nan Xia Po’ Mosque in Beijing to offer his Friday prayers.

what: 2019 novel Coronavirus can be cured by one bowl of freshly boiled garlic.
explanation: World Health Organization (WHO) has issued a clarification that garlic may have some antimicrobial properties but there is no evidence that it can protect people from the 2019 novel Coronavirus.

what: Videos of Pigs being buried in China due to the Coronavirus outbreak.
explanation: The videos posted are old. They are in no way related to the recent Coronavirus outbreak.

what: President Xi Jinping visits Masjid to pray for the Coronavirus vicitims
explanation: 2016 video of Xi Jjinping visiting a mosque is being shared in the context of the recent Coronavirus outbreak

what: Peope behaving abnormally in China due to Coronavirus
explanation: Old video clips are shared in the context of the recent Coronavirus outbreak

what: Coronavirus found in Broiler Chicken
explanation: No evidence to prove that Coronovirus found in the broiler chickens. WHO has clarified that meat cooked properly can be consumed.

what: Video of bats found under the tiles of many roofs in Hubei, China. They were the source of Coronavirus.
explanation: The video was not taken in China. It’s an old video uploaded on 05 July 2011 by a Miami based roofing company called ‘Istueta Roofing’. The bats in the video were found under the tiles during the process of replacing a roof for a customer in Miami (US).

what: Dettol can kill Coronavirus. The company know about the Corona virus back in 2019.
explanation: The ‘Coronavirus’ mentioned on Dettol bottle is the previous strains of Coronavirus, not the 2019 novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV). Also, Dettol manufacturer (‘RB’) has clarified that they do not yet have more details of the new virus and are not yet in a position to confirm levels of effectiveness against the new strain.

what: Coronavirus patients in China are being caught by officials on a highway.
explanation: The video in the post is the video of a ‘Mock drill’. The China SWAT team in the video is ‘practising’ to deal with Coronavirus patients.

what: Video of Police killing COVID-19 affected people in China.
explanation: The posted video was edited with three unrelated clips to falsely claim that Police with arms are killing people. The Yiwu Police have clarified that the armed Police in the video were on their duty to kill a rabid dog. And, the last clip is related to an accident.

what: Runny nose and coughing sputum suggest that one does not have COVID-19. They are not symptoms of COVID-19.
explanation: In the advisories issued by WHO, it can be seen that ‘runny nose’ and ‘sputum production’ are also symptoms of COVID-19.

what: Precautionary measures suggested by the UNICEF.
explanation: The viral message was not issued by the UNICEF. Some of the measures suggested in the message contradict the WHO’S view on COVID-19. Also, some have no scientific evidence.

what: Aaj Tak channel telecasted a program that said drinking alcohol or weed can cure COVID-19.
explanation: Aaj Tak channel did not telecast any program that said drinking alcohol or weed can cure COVID-19. The posted photos are taken from their fact-check episode. In the episode, they debunk the claim and conclude that neither a peg of alcohol nor weed can cure COVID-19.

what: Aaj Tak telecasted a news in which the Chinese PM said, ‘Reading Quran and offering namaz is the only cure for COVID-19’.
explanation: It is a clipped video of Aaj Tak’s fact-check. In the full version, it can be seen that Aaj Tak has debunked the claim and concluded that no such statement was made by the Chinese PM.

what: AIIMS team has said that Toddy has medicinal properties to cure Coronavirus
explanation: AIIMS team has never said that Toddy has medicinal properties to cure Coronavirus

what: No more deaths from COVID-19 as Israel scientists have discovered a vaccine for COVID-19.
explanation: Various vaccines proposed by Israel scientists and other researchers across the world are under development and are yet to be cleared for production and distribution. Israel’s MIGAL Research Institute is also in the process of producing a vaccine for COVID-19. According to WHO, as on 11 March 2020, there is no vaccine for COVID-19.

what: Most affected countries by COVID-19 are along the same 40-degree North latitude.
explanation: 40-degree North latitude passes through some of the countries most affected by COVID-19 but does not pass through half of the locations given in the post. Also, it does not touch Wuhan (Hubei Province – where around 60% of all the positive cases are reported), which is at around 30-degree North latitude.

what: Photo of Meat (mutton) affected by Coronavirus
explanation: It is a photoshopped image. No proof so far that Coronavirus is present in mutton

what: Video of Police in China taking into control suspected COVID-19 patients in the country.
explanation: The video shows Police in Hong Kong taking into control demonstrators who were protesting against the introduction of a controversial bill that would have allowed extraditions to mainland China.

what: After husband tested positive for coronavirus, wife fled from Bangalore to Agra .
explanation: The woman went to her parents place in Agra on 9 March, while her husband was confirmed positive for coronavirus on 12 March. Also, she didn’t enter Bangalore city. Karnataka government has also clarified that the woman didn’t flee to her parents’ place.

what: Indian President Ramnath Kovind pouring gaumutra (cow urine) on globe to prevent Coronavirus
explanation: 2017 image falsely shared as President Ramnath Kovind pouring gaumutra on globe to prevent Coronavirus

what: A worker of Prince hotel in Mehdipatnam (Hyderbad, India) has tested positive for Coronavirus.
explanation: The message is fake. In Telangana state, till date, only one confirmed case of Coronavirus is reported and the person who tested positive for the virus is a Software Engineer.

what: Office Memorandum of Ministry of Health & Family Welfare declaring holidays to the states of Maharashtra, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh and Sikkim in the wake of COVID-19.
explanation: No, the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare hasn’t declared holidays to the states of Maharashtra, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh and Sikkim. The Office Memorandum with such information is ‘fake’.

what: 500 crore Rupees fund allocated by Telangana CM KCR for Coronavirus prevention is entirely funded by Central Government
explanation: No, the entire fund is not given by the Central Government.

what: Video of American President Donald Trump announcing that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19 next Sunday.
explanation: In the video, American President Donald Trump hasn’t said that Roche Medical Company will launch the vaccine for COVID-19. He announced FDA’s approval of a Coronavirus ‘test’ developed by a company ‘Roche’ to increase and accelerate the country’s capacity to test for the virus.

what: 2000 people died of COVID-19 in one day (on March 15) in France
explanation: As per WHO, 36 people died of COVID-19 in France on March 15, not 2000 people

what: Oman is releasing pesticides in the air through helicopters to eliminate Coronavirus
explanation: Oman's Health Minsitry has clarified that they are not conducting any such operation with helicopters/

what: Drinking water every 15 mins will protect people from Coronavirus
explanation: WHO has clarified that drinking water is important for overall health but it does not prevent coronavirus infection.

what: Gargling with lukewarm water mixed with salt/vinegar will remove Coronavirus
explanation: Press Information Bureau (India) has clarified that Coronavirus cannot be treated by gargling with warm water mixed with salt and vinegar.

what: "Children under 8 are immune to the novel Coronavirus"
who: Socila Media and some News Agencies
explanation: Official WHO reports indicate that among infected there have been children as young as 2. Malaysian press have reported that 3 coronavirus cases in Malaysia include a 2-year-old boy. Also Australia's ABC reports: Queensland confirms third coronavirus case as eight-year-old child from Wuhan, China.

what: Health Canada has advised that by keeping the throat moist (by drinking water) can help preventing infection.
explanation: There is no scientific evidence to support this. Health Canada has never suggested this method.

what: Facts about Coronavirus outbreak
explanation: An FAQ on the recent Coronavirus outbreak.

what: The claim that the book The Eyes of Darkness predict the spread of Coronavirus in 1981
explanation: The book is a work of fiction that mentions a biological weapon called Wuhan-400 (Originally Gorki-400) that has no similarities to the Covid19. The other page, is from a totally different book “End of Days” by American psychic Sylvia Browne.

what: The name coronavirus on disinfecting spray can's reaffirms that the virus was known before the outbreak and might be planned
explanation: Coronaviruses have been known for decades. SARS and MERS were caused by coronaviruses. The companies (Lysol, Clorox,etc) have stated that their products have demonstrated effectiveness against viruses “similar” to COVID-19.

what: The cover of a TinTin book titled "TinTin in Wuhan" that shows the characters standing in an old Chinese market wearing special suits, while people are wearing masks.
explanation: This is a doctored image that is made of frames from two different TinTin books.

what: The Simpsons have predicted the coronavirus pandemic years ago, along with many other predictions.
explanation: Other than the "Osaka Flu" infecting many residents of Springfield, the events of the episode Marge in Chains (1993) have no similarities with the Covid19 pandemic and what is currently happening around the world.

what: Exposing Parviz Nouri Sayha, who claims he has made the medicine for coronavirus
explanation: Our investigations show that almost everything this person, who calls himself “professor” claims is fake and unfounded. Even his resume and bibliography is filled with fabricated items.

what: Iran's head of judiciary: The first centers that volunteered to suspend activities in response to the coronavirus outbreak were Religious Institutions and those connected to the clergy.
who: Iran's head of judiciary, Ebrahim Raiesi
explanation: This is an outrageous claim and couldn't be farther from the truth. Weeks after the outbreak, holy shrines and mosques refused to close down.

what: Iran's former president Mahmoud Ahmadinejad: It is clear to the world that the mutated coronavirus was produced in lab, manufactured by the warfare stock houses of biological war belonging to world powers.
explanation: Absolutely baseless!

what: The claim that a scientific paper published in Nature in 2015, shows that the new virus was developed in labs.
explanation: On the contrary, the authors state that viruses similar to SARS have been detected in populations of bats.

what: Iran’s deputy Health Minister: This year we have had 13,200 flu cases which caused the death of 108 people. Our population is a fourth of the US’s. Last year they had 28 million flu cases which resulted in 16k deaths. Yet nobody is restricting travel.
explanation: Flu’s death rate in the US is less than 0.1% and moreover deputy minister’s comparison of flu and covid19 is misleading.

what: A list of comments Finnish national health authorities has made publicly between 20th of January and 3rd of March. We got a request to fact check that list.
explanation: Currently, an image with the title "THL and coronavirus in the news" is being circulated in social media, gathering comments from the National Institute for Health and Welfare on coronavirus from January to March. The statements quoted by THL experts are quoted but appear to be largely inaccurate when removed from context. The list as a whole is deliberately misleading. Its purpose is to undermine the credibility of the responsible authority, THL, without providing it with verified information.

what: Coronavirus is enabled by 5G technology
explanation: There is no scientific proof that coronavirus is in any way linked to 5G.

what: Coronavirus is caused by bat-soup
explanation: There is no evidence that eating bat-soup is the cause of coronavirus.

what: Coronavirus was created in laboratory in Wuhan
explanation: There is no evidence that coronavirus was created in a laboratory in Wuhan.

what: BIll Gates contributed to the spread of coronavirus.
explanation: The work that Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation does on healthcare has in no way contributed to the spread of coronavirus.

what: Medical book states that coronavirus is just a common cold
explanation: COVID-19 is more dangerous than the common cold

what: holding your breath for 10sec can determine if you have COVID-19, drink water every 15 minutes
explanation: The article lists myths that go against WHO recommendations

what: drinking water in which garlic was boiled will cure you from COVID-19
explanation: There is no evidence to support this claim

what: image showing italian doctors
explanation: Images that were used belong to a campaign in Mexico for healtworkers rights

what: propolis cures COVID-19
explanation: There is no evidence to support this claim

what: a secret invasion of 40 thousand american troops immune to COVID-10 is ongoing in EUrope
explanation: A secret invasion of 40 thousand American troops on Europe is not happening

what: corporations invented the coronavirus
explanation: there is no evidence to support this claim

what: COVID-19 arrived in the US by train
explanation: the photo has been manipulated

what: COVID-19 is a human made/ american biological weapon
explanation: Scientific reseach shows that the virus is not human made

what: Croatian president tells people to buy in bulk for at least 2 weeks
explanation: the president did not say you should buy food to sustain you for two weeks

what: The link between COVID-19 and 5G is being hidden
explanation: the link is not being hidden because it doesnt exist

what: Coronavirus is actually chemtrail lungs
explanation: chemtrail lungs do not exist as a condition

what: wash your throat with salted water and apple vineger to cure COVID-19
explanation: who and other medical institutions say this is not a cure

what: spanish scientist says go to ronaldo or messi for the cure, you pay them more
explanation: the former spanish minister for agriculture never said this

what: you should leave your shoes outside, they carry the virus
explanation: official sources say this is not true

what: images showing coffins of COVID-19 victims in Italy
explanation: images in question were actually taken in 2013

what: chinese claim that the virus was created in 2015 in US
explanation: theres no evidence that supports this claim

what: Cristiano Ronaldo turned his hotels into hospitals
explanation: the claim is false

what: Video showing a woman eating a bat soup in Wuhan
explanation: Video shot in Palau in 2016

what: Video showing a man eating a bat soup in a restaurant in China
explanation: With identified many elements in the video that matched pictures published by Chinese bloggers who visited Palau and documented their trip.

what: Filipinos eating bat soup in Wuhan
explanation: YouTubers made the video last July in Palau

what: Bat market and bat meat being sold in Wuhan
explanation: Video taken in Indonesia (Manado)

what: Video of Wuhan market with dogs, snakes, rats and bats...
explanation: Video taken in Indonesia (Langowan)

what: caption on YouTube: "doctor affected by the virus hospital wuhan china"
explanation: Prior instances of the video had captions, confirmed by media reports, said the video showed a doctor collapsing in Yunnan province because of overwork and hypoglycemia.

what: Video showing a woman eating a bat soup in Wuhan (different video and person)
who: Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, TikTok, Instagram users, anonymous
explanation: We tracked the girl's social media accounts, confirmed they were authentic. She claims the video was taken over the summer but wouldn't tell were. The set up and meal look like Palau traditionnal bat soup but we couldn't confirm.

what: Close-up of a bat soup bowl that is eaten in China/Wuhan
who: Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, TikTok, Instagram users, anonymous
explanation: A local source in Palau said he recognized a specific local restaurant. Table, room setting and plates' decorations match with other pictures found online showing tourist dining in unspecified restaurant in Palau. Not enough elements for us to call it false but pretty close.

what: People panicking bout a COVID-19 case at the Dakar Airport
explanation: this footage has nothing to do with the coronavirus pandemic and was taken out of context from a Senegalese TV footage showing an exercise.

what: Chinese police use a fishing net to arrest a man with a high fever
explanation: The video shows  a police training exercise.

what: Chinese police kill a woman escaping a COVID-19 quarantine in China
explanation: The scene actually shows a motorbike accident.

what: People lying on the ground because in China because they got coronavirus
explanation: Video comes from South Africa during a initiation rite in a private school.

what: Chinse people fleeing China to Vietnam because of coronavirus.
explanation: People are actually going from Vietnam to China for work.

what: First patient healed in Algeria
explanation: The man is from Morocco and appears in a TV add for an hospital in Morocco.

what: Senegalese president and government appears with masks during a press conference.
explanation: The picture is digitally edited to add the masks.

what: Panic scene in Germany with people rushing into a supermarket.
explanation: The video is taken during the sales.

what: Demonstrations against Chinese people in Italy.
explanation: Anti-fascist demonstration on February 22 in Roma.

what: Racist scene against Chinese people in the metro in Belgium.
explanation: Vidéo is an excerpt of the Youtube channel "Would you react" with actors.

what: OMS staff member is spreading coronavirus on purpose.
explanation: The man is an astrophysician, and he is touching this lady because she is his girlfriend, and she is sick.

what: Picture showing the Mecca totally empty.
explanation: The picture is from a miniature designed by an artist.

what: Saddam Hussein explaining what is coronavirus about.
explanation: Sound has been edited. It's a video from 2003 where Saddam Hussein is talking about the USA/Irak war.

what: 35 italians tourist don't want to leave Ethiopia and go back in Italy bexause of Coronavirus
explanation: Testimonies seems to be invented and the characters quoted does not exist. The website is well known for clickbait content and false stories.

what: A train carrying vaccines with an inscription Covid-19
explanation: Content seems to be digitally edited, and there is no inscription on that location on such trains.

what: A package from AliExpress sent from China can spread the new coronavirus
who: Multiple Twitter accounts + Messages on franceinfo.fr news feed
explanation: The coronavirus need a living host to grow. This kind of virus lives only a few days in a liquid and only a few hours on an object. The virus would die during the long transport from China to France, for example. The scientist never observed this king of contamination before with any kind of coronavirus.

what: The coronavirus was created and patented by an American lab two years before this epidemy
explanation: These pre-existing patents are referring to other viruses and coronaviruses

what: Scientists and experts answer questions and rumors about the coronavirus (bat soup, Wuhan P4 Laboratory, patented virus, people collapsing, etc)
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

what: Cats and dogs can be infected and can contaminate humans with Covid-19
explanation: There is no evidence that pets such as dogs or cats can be infected with the new coronavirus, say WHO and French medical experts

what: A Chinese woman from Wuhan arrived in France with suspected symptoms of coronavirus
explanation: The Chinese embassy in France confirmed the presence of this Chinese woman in France and said that she gave reassuring news. According to French authorities, investigations are underway, but this suspicious case has never been officially reported.

what: Statistics are predicting millions of dead peoples and billions of infected people in a few days
explanation: There is no modelization of the virus yet. So it's impossible to predict anything about the epidemic.

what: franceinfo hosted a chat with a scientist in order to answer questions about the coronavirus, including fake news
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

what: Why it's dangerous to make your own hand sanitizer at home
explanation: It's dangerous to create your own hand sanitizer at home but DIY videos dont' tell you that.

what: Do Americans have to pay 3000 or 4000 $ for a day of containment ?
explanation: Some Americans had to pay 3000 or 4000 $ after being contained in hospital.

what: Did the French Health minister underestimate the risk of contamination in France ?
explanation: The French Health minister really said that the risk of seeing the virus spreading in France was almost equal to zero, but it was at the very beginning of the outbreak in China and her statement was consistent with the datas she had.

what: Is it true that people can't use the right of withdrawal at work because of the outbreak ?
explanation: French labor law experts think that the risk of being infected with the virus at work can be a reason to refuse going back to work in some cases, but not all.

what: Did the coronavirus mutated and became more agressive ?
explanation: Chinese scientists discovered that this coronavirus has taken two different types. They suggest that the second type could be more aggressive. But this is only a theory, never tested in lab and French scientists consider that there no really important mutation of the virus yet

what: Does France underestimate the outbreak ?
explanation: On social networks, many users claim that the number of coronavirus cases in France is underestimated, because there are fewer tests in France than elsewhere. But this international comparison is not really relevant.

what: Will the coronavirus epidemic disappear in April thanks to the heat, as Donald Trump said ?
explanation: It's impossible to predict the evolution of this epidemi, because this coronavirus is a new virus. Weather probably plays a role, but it remains to be determined among other factors.

what: Can pets contaminate humans ?
explanation: According to the WHO, there is no evidence that dogs or cats can be infected with the new coronavirus. French medical experts confirm that a virus crossing the species barrier is rare.

what: No, a confidential governmental document does not prove that the government has decided to postpone local elections because of the outbreak
explanation: This document is a fake. The government didn't take this decision

what: The far right leader Marine Le Pen says that the EU did't do anything against the outbreak
explanation: The EU has activated the civil protection mechanism,  launched aid program, mobilizes funds for research and called for more international cooperation and coordination

what: Is it useful to close borders to stop the outbreak ?
explanation: French medical experts say closing borders in order to prevent infected people from entering in France is ineffective. Likewise, health tests before entering the country have little effect.

what: Does a sulfur dioxide pollution in Wuhan reveal that China is burning bodies of victims ?
explanation: The map behind the rumor is not a real-time air quality report, but a forecast based on past datas, which therefore cannot take account of alleged recent events.

what: Satellite images showing high levels of sulphur dioxide above China are possible evidence of mass cremations of people who have died from coronavirus.
explanation: False. The maps are not satellite images, and do not show actual levels of sulphur dioxide. They are simply forecasts based on historical data and weather patterns.

what: "Japan has sent many masks to Wuhan, China. But China hasn’t supported Japan ever before."
explanation: China sent their rescue team and many goods at Great East Japan earthquake (2011), donated a lot of money to Japan at the 2016 Kumamoto Earthquake, and the Heavy Rain of July, 2018.

what: A team from @WorldPopProject has heat mapped the highest risk counties for the #WuhanCoronavirus. "Japan has the second highest country because the Abe administration doesn’t emforce immigration restrictions."
explanation: The ranking is based on Lunar New Year travel prior to the holiday in 2018. This report does not refer to any countries immigration restrictions in this year. Japan has the second highest risk country but it's not related to the immigration policy.

what: "Some Japanese people infected with the nove coronavirus were refused from a charter flight from Wuhan to Tokyo (on Jan.30) without any Japanese legal basis."
explanation: It is true that two Japanese people who may have been infected could not take a charter flight. They were not permitted to go through the Chinese immigration office because they were stuck at the quarantine station by Chinese medical staff. Japan didn't refuse them.

what: "DailyMail reported that a virus leaked from the Wuhan National Biosafety Laboratory was responsible for the pandemic."
explanation: The DailyMail article didn’t report that. Rutgers University microbiologist Dr Richard Ebright told DailyMail that "at this point there’s no reason to harbour suspicions" that the facility had anything to do with the outbreak, besides being responsible for the crucial genome sequencing that lets doctors diagnose it.

what: The Chinese government announced on official document "Garlic is a preventive food for Novel coronavirus."
explanation: The official document is not from China's central government. It's from Shanghai city government. On this original document, there is no mention about garlic or preventive food.

what: Novel coronavirus is commuicated by package or imported goods shipping from China to Korea.
explanation: Currently there is no evidence to support transmission of novel coronavirus by imported goods.  Also there have not been such cases in Korea.

what: The Korean Government pay travellers' medical expense for coronavirus without basis law.
explanation: According to IHR 2005, government is responsible for paying medical treatment expense to travellers. Accordingly, related Act also defines it.

what: All the soldiers in South Korea cannot go on leave because of the novel coronavirus(2019-nCoV) outbreak.
explanation: South Korea's ministry of national defense said, "The restrictions on all soldiers are not true at all. However, we only partially limited the area where there were confirmed cases."

what: According to a certain document, there are infected cases in some areas of South Korea, but the Koean government is hiding the cases.
explanation: The documents are confirmed as crafted documents. These case are under investigation by the Korea police.

what: The Korean Government took every facial mask from factorys to send masks to China?
explanation: Some sellers claimed this to consumers. However, it turns out to be false.

what: Virus arrives in Colombia
explanation: The piece says the Wuhan coronavirus was afound in a patient in the town of Ibagué, Colombia, and shows a written diagnosis to show it. However, the imacge shows it to be a different sort of coronavirus.

what: A case of coronavirus was confirmed in a small city called Ibague
explanation: The tweet was false because health authorities haven't confirmed the case.

what: Jair Bolsonaro has coronavirus
explanation: The tweet was false because health authorities haven't confirmed the case, it was a clickbait.

what: Garlic heals coronovirus
explanation: WHO said that there is no evidence that proves that garlic heals coronavirus.

what: Healthy ministry send an email about coronavirus
explanation: Health ministry of Colombia explaind that the email was false.

what: 30 cases of coranvirus in a small city called Barranquilla
explanation: At the time of this publicaction, the Health ministry hadn´t confirmed any cases of coronavirus in Barranquilla

what: Saline water killes coronavirus
explanation: There is no solid scientific evidence to indicate that mouthwash and saline water kills coronavirus

what: Tips for coronavirus: holding breath and drink water
explanation: There is no scientific evidence to indicate that holding breath and drinking water every 15 minutes kills coronavirus

what: Chine finds a vaccine for coronavirus
explanation: Chine didn`t find a vaccine for coronavirus.

what: Ibuprofen aggravates patients with coronavirus
explanation: There is no scientific evidencie that proves ibuprofen aggravates coronavirus patients

what: An image of coffies as a result of coronavirus
explanation: The images were taken in octuber 2013.

what: People with type A blood are more prove to get coronavirus
explanation: The study is preliminary and there is no scientific evidence that supports the relation between type blood and Covid-19.

what: That a tabletop exercise using a model of the current outbreak "predicted" 65 million people could die from the coronavirus
explanation: There was no prediction made at the tabletop exercise. It was held in October of 2019 and used a different model of the coronavirus, and no predicted death toll was estimated by the groups.

what: That explosion occured in Wuhan, China, tied to the coronavirus outbreak
who: Ricky DJ Moore II on YouTube
explanation: It was a video supposedly of an explosion in Wuhan, China. A search showed it was actually footage of the first of several explosions in Tianjin, China, from 2015

what: KNUST students discover vaccine for Coronavirus and cure patient in Cote d'Ivorie
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

what: Romania developed a coronavirus vaccine able to cure white people only
explanation: There is no known cure for the coronavirus. This is a hoax.

what: That the coronavirus was called a "plague" by the WHO, and that 2.9 million were infected while 950,680 people had died
explanation: A global emergency was declared by WHO. To date, 213 people had died as a result of the coronavirus and another 9,800 cases had been confirmed in mainland China, according to reports, while cases had been discovered in more than a dozen countries worldwide.

what: "patent on this "new" Corona virus expired on the 22nd, today"
explanation: As noted above, the patent for the vaccine for this new Wuhan strain did not expire on January 22, 2020. That patent is related to the SARS epidemic, which killed more than 800 people after it broke out in China in 2002.

what: "There's magically already a vaccine available."
explanation: Anthony S. Fauci, a top official at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), told Bloomberg Law that a potential vaccine "could move into early-stage human testing in the next three months."

what: That a 2015 research article about a lab-made coronavirus referred to the current outbreak
explanation: It was an opinion piece, and while facts used in the article appear accurate, it did not refer to the current coronavirus outbreak.

what: That the China-centered coronvirus had infected 2.8 million people and killed 112,000
explanation: This was a wild exaggeration of the facts. It supposedly relied on reporting from "covert intelligence sources." At the time of the story, some 900 people had been infected and 26 had died

what: That a spray could protect against the coronavirus outbreak
explanation: The product being hawked by the Genesis Church 2 is essentially bleach

what: Coronavirus is in Des Moines
explanation: The story came from a prank website where it got over 9000 Facebook engagements

what: Scripps urgent care in San Diego is on lockdown, two people with coronavirus isolated
explanation: Scripps denied it was true through their Twitter account, there was one person with the flu but no coronavirus.

what: Hair Weaves And Lace Front Wigs Made In China NOT Likely To Contain Coronavirus
explanation: There is very little chance of coronavirus spreading this way, and there have not been any reported cases of this happening.

what: Scientists did not claim Wuhan coronavirus is HIV-1 engineered "super weapon"
explanation: The scientific research cited was not peer-reviewed, and the paper was withdrawn by the researchers to revise their results.There was also a note saying it was only a preliminary study.

what: Bill Gates did not help fund patent for coronavirus
explanation: The Pirbright Institute addressed the conspiracy theories and said the patents involve infectious bronchitis virus (IBV) only, and the Gates Foundation did not fund that work.

what: Scientists from Australia did not create first vaccine for novel coronavirus
explanation: This website was a scam. There is no known, widely available or public vaccine for the coronavirus. The website that was taking orders was shut down.

what: Video from China does not actually show people fleeing from coronavirus quarantine
explanation: The video footage is originally from an anti-government protest that was posted in December 2019, well before the coronavirus quarantine began.

what: Vitamin C does not stop or slow novel coronavirus
who: Health Impact News, Orthomolecular Medicine News Service
explanation: There is, to date, no known cure for coronavirus. Medical professionals and researchers also said there was no conclusive evidence to suggest Vitamin C can treat or prevent coronavirus.

what: China did not seek court approval to kill over 20,000 coronavirus patients to stop the spread of the outbreak.
explanation: This unsubstantiated claim came from a website that published frequently false claims. There is no evidence that China went to courts looking for such approval. Claim was also debunked by several other outlets.

what: Autopsy did not reveal Wuhan doctor was murdered in his sickbed.
explanation: The story fabricates a quote and did not offer on-the-record source for its claim. It also came from a website that frequently publishes false information. Other news outlets confirmed Li Wenliang died from the coronavirus.

what: No coronavirus cases reported in Rome, Georgia
explanation: The medical facility issued a statement saying there was not a confirmed case.

what: Residential building was not set on fire in Wuhan to control spread of coronavirus.
explanation: A fire broke out in a different city in China, but officials said the fire had no connection to the coronavirus outbreak.

what: No proof that high-rise buildings have become human incinerators to combat spread of coronavirus
explanation: There was no concrete evidence to prove that buildings were being burned to stop coronavirus. The Twitter authority cited in the story was not credible.

what: Latest research by Chinese scientists did not say coronavirus will render most male patients infertile
explanation: The study has not been peer-reviewed. But the study also does not go as far as to say coronavirus will definitely cause infertility in men.

what: Data does not show massive release of sulfur dioxide gas near Wuhan
explanation: The images in the Twitter posts are not satellite measurements, and a member of NASA said the images did not show significantly increased SO2 measurements. Some other websites cited the images as evidence -- though false -- of bodies being burned due to coronavirus.

what: Popping bubble wrap does not expose people to coronavirus
explanation: Bubble wrap is not produced by people blowing air into the plastic. Claim originated from a satirical Facebook page that was shut down.

what: No evidence to support claim from a bioweapons expert that coronavirus is a biological warfare weapon
explanation: Dr. Francis Boyle did say that coronvirus is a biological warfare weapon, but the story lacks context. There is no supporting evidence to back up that suggestion. It was debunked as a rumor and untrue that coronavirus was made in a lab.

what: 20 million Chinese did not convert to Islam, and it was not proven that coronavirus does not affect Muslims
explanation: The video doesn't feature Chinese people, but rather Filipino men. Video footage predates major coronavirus reports.

what: Six coronavirus cases not confirmed in Wichita, Kansas
explanation: No cases were confirmed there, and claim came from non-credible websites.

what: No evidence coronavirus is bioweapon leaked from Wuhan lab
explanation: Already disproved similar claims. Scientists in Wuhan insisted no link between virus and labs.

what: Scientists did not find cocaine kills coronavirus
explanation: Fake story was generated by a website that allows people to create their own news stories. Previously busted claim.

what: Florida Man NOT Arrested For Robbery Using Cough As A Weapon

what: CDC Did NOT Recommend Men Shave Their Beards To Protect Against Coronavirus
explanation: The claim is based on a Centers for Disease Control chart created in 2017 to advise medical workers on the best practices for wearing "filtering facepiece respirators" during contact with viral patients. It was not intended for the general public - nor specifically for preventing the spread of coronavirus.

what: Doctors Do NOT Recommend Carbon Filter Face Masks To Prevent Coronavirus Spread
explanation: Videos falsely claims that doctors are recommending carbon filter masks as a way to protect families, although the FDA and CDC both concluded that they are not effective for children and are not recommended for home use. The videos are used to sell the masks to people concerned about the coronavirus outbreak.

who: Russian TV Channel Ren TV, Igor Nikulin, military expert and former Georgian Minister of Security Igor Giorgadze (comment made in 2018)
explanation: There are several conspiracy narratives developed in the report, including on US Labs artificially linked to the Coronavirus. In the context of conspiracy narrative, the story author names  Tbilisi-based Lugar Laboratory of biological research, making an unreasonable parallel between virus found in China and Tbilisi Laboratory. Moreover, the story features the archive material from 2018, in which former Georgian Minister of Security Igor Giorgadze talks about the threats coming from the Lugar Lab. Lugar Laboratory is a part of the National Center for Disease Control and Public Health of Ministry of Health of Georgia. For years, Lugar Lab has been a target of Kremlin, Russia affiliated media, Russian politicians and high officials. Except for US-financed C Hepatitis Treatment program, there are other conspiracies linked to the lab.

explanation: Dr. Mohammad Imran,  an Ayurveda doctor,  said, “It is merely a rumor which has gone viral on social media .There is no scientific evidence which backs the claim that sniffing clove and camphor can cure coronavirus. However, natural camphor and clove does have certain health benefits as it can cure fungus and bacteria”.

what: As coronavirus outbreak surges, PM Narendra Modi has decided to facilitate fellow countrymen with free masks under the ‘Swacch Bharat’ scheme.
explanation: the government has not announced any such scheme under which it is aimed to provide free masks. The viral webpage may be a part of the decade-old phishing technique or it may be an attempt to collect the data. However, the intent behind creating this webpage is not yet clear but it is crystal clear that the webpage doesn’t belong to Indian govt and might be a venture of some fraudulent organization.

what: Chinese intelligence officer terms the Novel Coronavirus as a biological weapon invented by China. The viral post also claims that the damage caused by the pandemic is being normalized by the Chinese officials. The website which has published the alleged testimony of the said Chinese intelligence officer has published the report with the headline, “CORONA UNMASKED: Chinese Intelligence Officer Reveals True Magnitude of China’s Fake “Coronavirus” Crisis – 包含中文字符版本”.
explanation: the story published by the Reddit community No Sleep is just a horror story and does not have anything to do with reality. the community itself terms it as a storytelling platform and not a true story publisher.

what: Corona virus patients are being caught on highways in China.
explanation: The video is not about the corona virus patients being caught, but of the training and mock drill given to the Swat team in China.

explanation: Mecca Medina of Saudi Arabia was neither closed due to fear of virus. To take some precautions, there was a ban on the arrival of travelers from few countries. On 5 March people were prevented from going inside because of sanitization.

what: A viral message listing false and unrelated statements about Coronavirus has falsely been attributed to the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund (UNICEF).
explanation: No such advisory has been released by UNICEF. Nor much is known about novel coronavirus as it is a newly found coronavirus

what: Drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water and salt or vinegar eliminates the novel corona virus. Spread the information as you can save someone with this information.
explanation: According to GMA news report, saline gargles or gargling with water and salt will provide no protection against or cure for the 2019 novel coronavirus acute respiratory disease (2019-nCoV ARD). The report also carried a statement by the Dr. Eric Domingo “I think this is a home remedy that has been followed for many, many generations and I don’t think there’s going to be any harm in doing it. Saline gargle has always been advocated to improve mostly symptoms of sore throat...I don’t think there is any evidence that it will kill a virus,” Domingo said.

what: Ministry of Health ITALY released a small video, HOW the virus spreads!!!... BEST VIDEO. Please see ..how innocently it spread. SOAP is the remedy CLEAN/ WASH ur Hands always
explanation: the viral video is not released by the health ministry of Italy in the wake of coronavirus but it is long-existing on YouTube, we reached the conclusion that the viral claim is ‘Misleading’.

what: The viral video claims to show the visuals of china police personnel trying to control the patients allegedly suffering from the pandemic.
explanation: the viral video has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak and is related to police storming the metro in the wake of Hong Kong protests.

what: Football player Cristiano Ronaldo turned all his hotels into hospitals to help Corona virus patients and is paying doctors and the staff.

The news was also denied by HRT, Gol, Haber, Pogled, Flash and Hayat, while the Sport and Magazine plus portals deleted their articles.

what: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Reddy has claimed that ‘Paracetamol’ is the only medication for coronavirus.
explanation: It is evident from our findings and Dr. Pandey’s testimony that Paracetamol can help with the coronavirus symptoms but it cannot entirely cure coronavirus. We also found that Paracetamol is not the only medication that can help with coronavirus symptoms as there are many medications.

what: The United States of America threatened Iraq with Coronavirus in 1990.

what: A WhatsApp forward is doing the rounds which claims that Prime Minister Narendra Modi called for a 14-hour long ‘Janta Curfew’ on 22 March from 7 am to 9 pm because the lifespan of the coronavirus at one place is only 12 hours and if we all follow the Janta Curfew religiously then the chain will be broken
explanation: There is no clear information on the lifespan of the novel coronavirus. However, various study reports have suggested a similar lifespan as that of other coronaviruses. PM Modi’s motive behind calling for a ‘Janta Curfew’ was just to curb the spreading of novel coronavirus and the Government has not claimed that the Janta Curfew is called to kill the virus hence the claim turned out to ‘Misleading’ in our fact-check.

what: Seeing the rise of novel coronavirus in India, the World Health Organization (WHO) has recommended the government of *India to lockdown* the country from April 15 to June 15.
explanation: we reached out to one of the representatives in India, who rubbished the claim and clarified that WHO has not made any such recommendation.

explanation: The lady in the viral video is not Canadian PM Justin Trudeau’s wife Sophie Grégoire Trudeau but a British national namely Tara Jane Langston.

All planes arriving from China will be sent to a separate terminal in the Moscow Sheremetyevo airport. Aeroflot reduced the frequency of flights to Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou until Feb. 29

The patient at Asian Hospital and Medical Center in Alabang, Muntinlupa City is among the 24 persons under investigation (PUIs) for the possible 2019 nCoV infection.

what: The 2019 novel coronavirus (nCoV) is a "type of rabies" that can be contracted by eating bats.

what: Evidence indicates COVID-19 virus escaped a Chinese lab that was researching it, thus causing the outbreak
who: Steven W. Mosher, New York Post
explanation: Overall, Mosher’s argument is based on unfounded speculation and scientific inaccuracies. Multiple scientific studies have indicated that the virus has a natural origin, not the result of human engineering

what: "[The coronavirus is] “new” yet it was lab-created and patented in 2015"
who: Chris Kirckof and Jordan Sather on Facebook and Twitter
explanation: The post references the Wuhan coronavirus, but the patent filed is clearly stated to be for the SARS coronavirus, which caused the 2003 outbreak. Neither the SARS nor Wuhan coronavirus is lab-created; evidence points to an animal reservoir as the source of infection.

what: Coronavirus hits 15% fatality rate
explanation: The 15% fatality rate from coronavirus (2019-nCoV) applied only to the initial cluster of 41 patients with confirmed infection and severe symptoms, as reported in The Lancet. Coronavirus infections can also produce mild symptoms, which likely went undetected. The mortality rate based on a group of more than 800 patients with laboratory-confirmed infection suggests that the fatality rate is closer to 3%.

what: coronavirus is not a new virus
explanation: Many coronavirus strains have already been discovered, but new strains regularly emerge due to mutations. The particular coronavirus responsible for the outbreak originating in Wuhan, China, provisionally named 2019-nCoV, is a new strain that was identified by scientists after sequencing its genome.

what: Coronavirus contains "HIV insertions"
explanation: This claim is based on a study which compared extremely short protein sequences between the 2019 novel coronavirus and HIV, a practice likely to give false positives. The study’s authors also overlooked checking for potential similarities between 2019-nCoV and other organisms. As it turned out, these short protein sequences were similar to many other organisms, not just HIV, thereby refuting the claim that 2019-nCoV contains DNA from the HIV virus.

what: 2019 novel coronavirus contains "pShuttle-SN" sequence proving laboratory origin
who: Alex Jones, Info Wars; Mike Adams, Natural News
explanation: The pShuttle-SN vector was designed by researchers seeking to develop a potential SARS vaccine. However, the 2019 novel coronavirus does not contain a sequence from the pShuttle-SN vector as claimed. There is no evidence supporting the claim that 2019-nCoV is man-made.

what: Every election year has a disease; coronavirus has a contagion factor of 2; coronavirus has a cure rate of 99.7% for those under 50 it infects
explanation: Every year in the U.S. is an election year, if taking into account midterm elections as well as presidential elections, and contrary to the claim, not every election year has had a disease outbreak, as implied in the claim. In addition, the transmissibility of the coronavirus, represented by the “basic reproduction number”, is still under study. Currently, the basic reproduction numbers reported for the virus causing COVID-19 range between around 2 to more than 6.

what: Coronavirus outbreak linked to eating bats
who: Emma Parker, writer at the Daily Star (and many others)
explanation: Bats are known natural reservoirs for coronaviruses. However, many other animals, such as civet cats and snakes, can also carry these viruses. There is currently not enough evidence to conclude that the 2019 coronavirus outbreak resulted from people eating bats in Wuhan, China.

what: The coronavirus pandemic can be dramatically slowed, or stopped, with the immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C
who: Andrew W. Saul, Orthomolecular Medicine News Service
explanation: Maintaining an adequate intake of vitamin C is important for staying healthy. However, evidence from clinical trials shows that regular vitamin C supplementation does not prevent viral respiratory tract infections such as the common cold, which can be caused by coronaviruses, in the general population. Although some studies have shown a reduced incidence of the common cold in individuals undergoing severe physical stress, such as marathon runners.

what: The coronavirus outbreak is not actually caused by a virus, but by 5G technology
explanation: There is no causal link between COVID-19 and 5G technology. The cause of the disease has been definitively identified in scientific studies as a novel coronavirus. 5G technology uses low-energy radio waves, which do not damage DNA or cells unlike ionizing radiation.

what: Shanghai Government Officially Recommends Vitamin C for COVID-19
who: Andrew W. Saul, Orthomolecular Medicine News Service
explanation: Intravenous high-dose vitamin C has been used to treat patients with COVID-19 in certain Chinese hospitals, but it has not been recommended by the Shanghai government as claimed. The OMNS article also cherry-picks the treatment’s potential benefits from two reports, leaving out the potential side effects, including nausea and kidney stones, and failing to mention contraindications for pregnant women and individuals with cancer and other medical conditions.
